@jbonofre can you take a peek at this one?
I would not do a merge, but a rebase instead. Do you mind if I try on my side ?
This is actually a rebase, not merge, just rebase seems not enough, some code change is also needed. Feel free to try on your side @jbonofre .

It build failed because previously referenced BEAM version `0.7.0-SNAPSHOT` could not be found. If I make the necessary code change, the code will conflict the `DSL_SQL` branch, because I already rebased from `master`, I cann't rebase from `DSL_SQL` again to resolve the conflict.. Need help here @jbonofre .

A really simple PR for some classes that are violating the Logger naming convention.
R: @jbonofre
@aaltay The issue was that the serialization code was different and apparently was losing details that broke the ESIOTest, I put HIFIO readExternal/writeExternal and everything seems to work now.

@jbonofre Thanks for offering you help, I am sorry I didn't answer before but I was quite busy and somehow forget to take a look at this. I think I found the issue so can you please take a look now and merge (asuming that you agree and that Jenkins is happy with it).
No problem. I take a look.

comons-compress seems to be used currently by
- java-sdk-core, shaded, not epxosed
- spark-runner, provided dep
- flink-runner, version upgrade of the transitive flink dependency

So it might be helpful if someone of the flink-runner team has also a look, wether this incurs any issues.

After 1) upgrade & make code change 2) rebase. The result branch will conflict with the DSL_SQL branch due to the rebase: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3253/conflicts
I don't think so, you may need do it with two PRs.

If this bug could go by unnoticed then maybe the semantics of the different state types are not defined clearly enough and we are also missing `ValidatesRunner` tests. The bug might be re-introduced in the future and other Runners might have the same bug.

btw, welcome back @mxm
@aljoscha, very quick! I was about to launch the same tests :1st_place_medal:

R: @aljoscha 

This LGTM, especially as it fixes a bug in the core SDK. We can separately version Spark/Flink as needed, but since Spark is provided may not matter much.

This PR shouldnt be merged right now. It seems to break https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/extensions/google-cloud-platform-core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/gcp/GcpCoreApiSurfaceTest.java

At least currently i am not able to do a (private) release.
@peihe The Flink ValidatesRunner tests are currently failing, I have a fix for that in #3258.
